text:
1. Set up Chainsaw to load configuration and log files contained in the ZIP
attachment
2. Restart Chainsaw (all 4 log files should be loaded into separate panels)
3. Go to View --> Create custom expression LogPanel
4. Enter the expression 'xAngM-ezkc20mb-4h' and hit "OK"
5. A new log panel is created, which should show logs from all 4 original panels
6. In the "Refine focus on" field, enter PROP.application ~= 'server.log' (logs
should appear)
7. In the "Refine focus on" field, enter PROP.application ~= '2.log' (logs
should appear)
8. In the "Refine focus on" field, enter PROP.application ~= '1.log' (logs
should appear, but don't)
9. In the "Refine focus on" field, enter PROP.application ~= 'xenon.log' (logs
should appear, but don't)

I have tried multiple variations on this configuration with these files: all
combinations of 2, 3, and 4 receivers configured. In all cases, the logs from 2
 panels appear and no more. The preference always seems to be for the
"server.log" and "2.log" files, with the "xenon.log" and "1.log" logs least
likely to appear.

I have also tried exporting these files in XML format and reloading into
Chainsaw, but the end result was the same. I was able to unify all the logs into
a single panel only by changing the "Tab identifier" configuration from
"PROP.hostname - PROP.application" to "PROP.hostname". However, this is a
workaround that won't help in all cases.

Strangely, I have also used Chainsaw with a different set of logs, and was able
to unify the logs of 3 different files via a custom expression logpanel without
any problems.
creator: timothy.high@sknt.com
timothy.high@sknt.com
text:
Created attachment 19779
Log files and Chainsaw configuration

Try changing the cyclic buffer in application-wide preferences to 99999 - when I
used a large cyclic buffer I received the correct number of events.

I think there's a bug related to custom expression log panels receiving events
from panels which have hit the cyclic buffer (I saw the wrong number of events
in the custom expression logpanel when the cyclic buffer was set to 5000 events
per tab.

Let me know if the workaround works for you (and I'll try to see if I can figure
out the bug).
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Try changing the cyclic buffer in application-wide preferences to 99999 - when I
> used a large cyclic buffer I received the correct number of events.
> 
> I think there's a bug related to custom expression log panels receiving events
> from panels which have hit the cyclic buffer (I saw the wrong number of events
> in the custom expression logpanel when the cyclic buffer was set to 5000 events
> per tab.
> 
> Let me know if the workaround works for you (and I'll try to see if I can figure
> out the bug).
> 

Hmm... interesting. It worked, but only when I forced a reload of the receivers.
No matter what the configuration, when Chainsaw loads initially, it doesn't join
all the logs. So:

1. Start Chainsaw
2. Create custom expression panel
3. Force receivers to reload
4. Refine focus to see logs from specific files

(probably steps 2 and 3 could be swapped)
creator: timothy.high@sknt.com
sdeboy@iname.com
text:
The tablemodel holding the events was preventing 'duplicates' (meaning events with the same 'ID' (row number).  This would be an issue with a custom expression logpanel.

I removed that limitation in svn 928161.
